org.trimou.engine.segment

Interface Segment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContainerSegment
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommentSegment, ExtendSectionSegment, ExtendSegment, InvertedSectionSegment, LineSeparatorSegment, PartialSegment, RootSegment, SectionSegment, SetDelimitersSegment, TextSegment, ValueSegment

    @Internal
public interface Segment
    Compiled template segment. Any segment is considered thread-safe (most often immutable) once the compilation is finished.
    Author:
    Martin Kouba

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Appendable execute(Appendable appendable, ExecutionContext context)
      Execute this segment (e.g. write down some variable value).
      String getLiteralBlock()
      Note that the text is reconstructed and will not be an exact copy when "Set Delimiter" tags are used.
      Origin getOrigin() 
      MustacheTagInfo getTagInfo() 
      String getText() 
      SegmentType getType() 

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        SegmentType getType()
        Returns:
        the segment type

      • getText

        String getText()
        Returns:
        the segment text (a tag key, a line separator text, etc.)

      • getOrigin

        Origin getOrigin()
        Returns:
        the origin of this segment or null in case of this segment is a template

      • getTagInfo

        MustacheTagInfo getTagInfo()
        Returns:
        the info about the original tag or null if the segment does not represent a tag (e.g. SegmentType.TEXT)

      • getLiteralBlock

        String getLiteralBlock()
        Note that the text is reconstructed and will not be an exact copy when "Set Delimiter" tags are used.
        Returns:
        the reconstructed literal block this segment represents (original text before compilation)
        See Also:
        Lambda.InputType.LITERAL, HelperDefinition.getContentLiteralBlock()

      • execute

        Appendable execute(Appendable appendable,
                   ExecutionContext context)
        Execute this segment (e.g. write down some variable value).
        Parameters:
        appendable -
        context -
        Returns:
        the appendable which should be used for the next executions
